sentences.english: The gold peal son station rises and unexpectedly wants Pan teacher in pique.
sentences.chinese: 金铃儿愤然站起，竟是要叛师。

sentences.english: Collect leave, younger sister of your Cheng Yi does not have face very much, step down a stage in anger.
sentences.chinese: 罗的离去，令程伊妹很没面子，愤然走下台去。

sentences.english: Several members , refusing to accept the decision of the vote , got up and stormed out .
sentences.chinese: 几个成员拒绝接受表决的结果，愤然而起，猛冲出去。

sentences.english: She turned and flung out without a word.
sentences.chinese: 她转过身，一言不发就愤然离开了。

sentences.english: Then the young guys carried their bags and left angrily.
sentences.chinese: 小伙子背起蛇皮袋，愤然离开。

sentences.english: He tossed out of the office.
sentences.chinese: 他愤然扬头走出办公室。

sentences.english: She flounced out of the room.
The wolves and dingoes walked out in protest.
sentences.chinese: 狼和野狗愤然离会表示抗议。

sentences.english: Democratic Party members walked out of Legco in protest at the retention of appointed seats in the district councils.
sentences.chinese: 民主党不满区议会保留委任制愤然拉队离场抗议。

sentences.english: I would indignantly refuse to have any dealings with a nurse or doctor or teacher who hid his or her face, let alone a tax inspector or customs official.
sentences.chinese: 我会愤然拒绝与遮住脸的护士，医生或教师打交道。

sentences.english: Mr. Gou angrily dismisses the critical coverage.
sentences.chinese: 郭台铭愤然否认了那些批评报导。

sentences.english: Xiao Jingyun angrily left Taipei, came to Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 萧静芸愤然离开台北，来到上海。

sentences.english: He flounced out of the room in a rage.
She turned and flung out of the room without a word.
sentences.chinese: 她转过身，一言不发就愤然离开了。

sentences.english: She turned and flung off without a word.
sentences.chinese: 她转过身去，一言不发愤然离去。

definition: unable to restrain one's anger (idiom); in a towering rage
variant of 憤憤|愤愤[fen4 fen4]
variant of 憤憤不平|愤愤不平[fen4 fen4 bu4 ping2]
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
lit. to slap the table and stand up (idiom); fig. at the end of one's tether/unable to take it any more
